issueDTO.title: Go through and add thumbnails to each tutorial gallery entry
issueDTO.description: Some of the tutorial gallery entries don't have a thumbnail image configured. For some which do, there may be a better choice for that notebook. It would be good to go through each entry and configure a thumbnail for each.
comments: If you want to tackle this one, please get in touch about the details.

See PR #874 for a potential solution. [Update: I have now applied this approach to the remainder of the tutorials, and only two tutorials remain without a thumbnail].

Thumbnails are not always automatically generated for the tutorial gallery.

Sometimes the thumbnail isn't automatically generated, but can be set in the tutorial metadata.

However, there are other instances where we have not figured out how to set a thumbnail image in the metadata. This is particularly the case for tutorials with interactive, non-static plots (e.g. plotly). Additionally, some tutorials don't have any plots.

I think I have found a way to add thumbnails to the tutorial gallery without using the tutorial metadata.

PR #874 adds images to four of the tutorial gallery thumbnails:
- Binary Contingency Table Tutorial
- Risk Matrix Score Tutorial
- Isotonic Regression Tutorial
- Block Bootstrapping Tutorial

My solution is a little clunky, but (a) I struggled to find **any solution** at all (it took hours to even come up with this less than ideal solution) and (b) I wanted to make it relatively straightforward to explain and maintain over time.

I am putting up this PR now, before finishing off the rest of the images, to check it actually works properly when merged into develop. (It built okay on my machine, but I would like to make sure it actually works).

If this is successful, when I get a chance I will try and add the rest of the thumbnails. When I get a chance, I will also attempt to document what the approach is, both so that I can remember and so that other people can also follow the process.

If anyone has a more elegant solution, then great.

@nicholasloveday I think you have raised this before as something that would be good to do, so feel free to take a look at what I have done and see what you think.

This has now been merged to develop, and I can see all four thumbnails (binary contingency table; risk matrix score; isotonic regression; block bootstrapping) are rendering properly in the tutorial gallery on readthedocs. So when I get a chance, I will keep going with the approach and do my best to document the process.

Some quick notes, while I remember, to make it easier when documenting the approach:
- Save image in tutorials/images
- Link image in tutorials/images/Images_for_tutorial_gallery_thumbnails.ipynb
- Add details to conf.py

Where they were previously missing, I have now added thumbnails to the tutorial gallery for all but two of the tutorials. You can see them on the latest branch of readthedocs: https://scores.readthedocs.io/en/latest/tutorials/Tutorial_Gallery.html

The two tutorials that don't yet have a thumbnail are:
- Diebold Mariano (I have opened issue #876)
- Pandas API (@tennlee said to leave this for the time being).

I haven't yet documented the approach. I will endeavour to do this when I can.

issueDTO.title: [p5.strands] Add reference entries for each hook
issueDTO.description:
### Increasing access

In 2.0, we released p5.strands! Currently, the documentation is a little sparse, and you have to find either our one tutorial, or look at the examples on a base shader (e.g. baseMaterialShader.) The text of the referencedoesn't mention strands. If we can document p5.strands more like how we document regular p5 functions, more people can discover it, and learning how to use it will be more straightforward.

### Most appropriate sub-area of p5.js?

- [ ] Accessibility
- [ ] Color
- [ ] Core/Environment/Rendering
- [ ] Data
- [ ] DOM
- [ ] Events
- [ ] Image
- [ ] IO
- [ ] Math
- [ ] Typography
- [ ] Utilities
- [x] WebGL
- [ ] Build process
- [ ] Unit testing
- [ ] Internationalization
- [ ] Friendly errors
- [ ] Other (specify if possible)

### Feature enhancement details

A p5.strands snippet might look something like this:
```js
myShader = baseMaterialShader().modify(() => {
  let time = uniformFloat(() => millis());
  getWorldInputs((inputs) => {
    inputs.position.y +=
      20 * sin(time * 0.001 + inputs.position.x * 0.05);
    return inputs;
  });
});
```
The `getWorldInputs` function is a **hook**. These hooks are currently only described on the reference for the base shaders that use them (e.g. https://beta.p5js.org/reference/p5/basematerialshader/), and are currently described in GLSL, as that was the only way to modify shaders at the time those docs were written.

I'm proposing that we:
- Create a new reference page for each hook function (e.g. `getObjectInputs`, `combineColors`, etc)
  - Since these methods are dynamically created, the reference pages can be made by placing a doc comment block at the end of a file describing each method even though the method itself is not next to the comment block (similar to [how properties of classes are documented.](https://github.com/processing/p5.js/blob/9515a629fd6979a20e0988ff6bb4b1c96eef6b2d/src/webgl/p5.Framebuffer.js#L1837-L1889))
  - Put these in a new p5.strands section or subsection of the reference by using `@module` (for section) and `@submodule` (for subsection) in the doc comments. Open to ideas about exactly where in the reference it should go!
  - Describe **without GLSL** how to use the hook
  - Create (or copy from the base shader) an example or two for each hook reference (e.g. for hooks coming from multiple shaders, maybe show an example of each?)
  - Link back to all the base shader references that include it (e.g. `getObjectInputs` is on I think all of our base shaders)
- Update the base shader docs to link to all the individual hook docs rather than describing them all in a table
- Update the `shader.modify()` docs to mention p5.strands JS callbacks as well as the object-with-glsl option currently described

We don't have to do all of these in one go, I can make a subtasks for each if someone is interested in getting started on just a part of this 🙂
comments: Hi @davepagurek ,I want to work on this, assign to me
Thanks @Abhayaj247!

For location: we currently have the rest of the p5.strands implementation in `src/webgl/ShaderGenerator.js`, potentially we could add these doc comment blocks to the end of that file? Or @lukeplowden if you think that file is getting too busy, then splitting these out into a separate file like you describe works too.

The doc comment structure looks good in general! Some small modifications:
- If you add `@for p5` then that tells the reference that this is a global function and not a class function
- `getWorldInputs` itself actually has no return value, and takes in a single function as a parameter. That function is what needs to take in an object containing those properties, and return a modified object. Maybe take a look at the callbacks in loading methods like [`loadImage`](https://beta.p5js.org/reference/p5/loadimage/) for an example of how to do the type for that.
  - For the properties on an input, @lukeplowden and @perminder-17  what do you think would be the best way to describe those? `[x, y, z]` sorta looks like you'd access it like an array (e.g. `position[0]`) rather than like an object (`position.x`), but describing it like `{ x, y, z }` might be syntactically confusing too. It's kind of like a `p5.Vector`, but also it isn't one. What do you think about describing it like "an object with `x`, `y`, and `z` properties"?
  - If we do the above, we may need to replace the `u` and `v` for the texture coordinate property with `x` and `y`, since those are the names you'd have to access its values with
- As a last thing, as part of the description, can we also list and link to the reference for the shaders that have that hook?

EDIT: one other thought. Currently we still have the `@experimental` label on other strands-related things, so we maybe should add that to these too for consistency.

Also if it helps, feel free to make a [draft PR](https://github.blog/news-insights/product-news/introducing-draft-pull-requests/) with just some of the changes if you want to get feedback before then doing all the rest.

Thank you for the detailed feedback @davepagurek ! 

I???ll create a draft PR with just a few of the updated doc comments (for example, getWorldInputs, combineColors, and getPointSize) so you can review the style, level of detail, and file location before I update the rest.

Also, is it required to use the full PR template (with checklist, screenshots, etc.) for a draft PR, or is a simpler description acceptable at this stage? I want to make sure I???m following the project???s preferred workflow.

Thanks again for your guidance - looking forward to your feedback on the draft PR!
Feel free to keep it simple for a draft 🙂 The rest can all be added later.

Hi @davepagurek ,

I???ve created a draft PR for early feedback on the p5.strands documentation changes : #7920.

The PR includes JSDoc doc comments and JavaScript examples for a few hooks (getWorldInputs, combineColors, getPointSize) as discussed.

Once I get feedback on the style, level of detail, and file location, I???ll update the rest of the hooks in the same way.

Thanks for your guidance!

Hi @davepagurek !

Just a friendly reminder - whenever you have a chance, could you please take a look at the draft PR #7920 opened for the p5.strands documentation?

I???m looking for feedback on the style, level of detail, and file location before proceeding with the rest of the hooks.

Thank you!

issueDTO.title: Remove Worker/Troop slider
issueDTO.description:
We have many new features in the pipeline (trains, factories, upgradeable units), so I think we need to take a step back and see where we can remove complexity that doesn't add much strategy.

The worker/troop slider isn't very useful imo. It typically sits at 95% and is not moved much. I think we should remove it and remove the entire concept of workers, have just troops. 

I'm not 100% sure if it should be removed or not, but we should create test branch and see how it plays.

Removing that bar will simplify the UI, and make the mobile experience better as well.
comments: Another option: make troops cost gold.

I can pick this up!

Instead of troops now costing money, I can explore the possibility of being able to purchase troops to bolster reserves. In my opinion, having troops cost money really slows gameplay down and discourages purchasing improvements.

When purchasing troops to refill reserves, unlike the current behavior of gifting troops, you will receive a short burst of "recruitment", where population growth is increased but the new population will be troops. This quick burst tapers off in some sort of logarithmic fashion.

The larger the investment, the more aggressive your burst of reserves.

The above is just an idea and not the intended solution to this issue. However this can be something we can think about as a follow-up.

I won't bog down this issue with meta and gameplay discussion just yet, let's just see how the game plays in testing with this defaulted distribution when everyone needs only to worry about troop count.

I really think that adapting troops/worker ratio during a match is a crucial part of a player strategy . 
Please dont remove it.
IMHO it would be better to show a button to hide it + config hide / show by default, and keyboard shortcut (hide + adapt ratio)

Worker/troop trade-off feels like a good idea, but the UI slider feels like a bad UI for it: the percentage is rarely the immediate thing users care about. With the current mechanics it feels like the controls should be a list of options: optimize for money with minimal troop count compared to neighbors, optimize for defence, optimize for offence, etc.

issueDTO.title: About the automatic carriage return problem of pasting part
issueDTO.description:
### What would you like to be added?

Remove the paste return to prevent the message from being automatically sent when pasting.

### Why is this needed?

About the automatic carriage return problem of pasting part

During use, we often need to paste some errors, codes, etc. into cli for communication, but I found that now no matter in the web editor, carriage return will be attached when pasting. This will cause me to send the problem directly after pasting. But in fact, I didn't finish writing. But when I stopped by esc, I tried to retrieve the previous conversation, but it disappeared, and I could never complete the pasting operation.

Another way is to copy and paste it into an unformatted part first, such as WIN+R to run the input box before copying and pasting it into cli. I think this is a very big problem and seriously affects development efficiency.

I wonder if the last space can be automatically cleaned when pasting to prevent sending messages before editing is completed.

Now as long as it involves me entering some text, and then I try to combine errors in multiple locations to ask questions. It can't be completed at all. I tried \ enter shift, but it didn't work.

### Additional context

_No response_
comments:
Ubuntu and some bespoke Linux here. Miraculously in Gemini CLI's GUI the EOL marks in the pasted snippets so far have been rightly converted to some marks that do not trigger sending the command. (That is: I do not have this problem). 
(While e.g. Grok AI's GUI is awful in that respect indeed: every copied string from its own GUI appends  double EOLs, methinks) 


Two tips for now: 
A. Just keep a scratchpad file open in the same folder so that Gemini can access it. Then you can paste there anything, without worrying. Gemini then shall read it via `read_file` when you tell her to do so. Just keep that TXT file open in another window: `gedit`, `notepad` etc. one.  
B. Describe what to do, then add some "code here:" as an informal marker between intent and source, and the code as the source (that may indeed trigger execution then).

It is a method, I understand what you mean. Create a temp.txt file to handle pasting. But many times we don't need a large text, such as a small error message, which can also cause this problem. I understand that it is because of system reasons and some IDEs or webs have implicit line breaks, which I think should be automatically cleaned up. I can indeed use the method you gave for the time being. Thank you for your reply.

Thanks for flagging this, @ISensuiI! Accidental sends on paste are annoying. A quick fix could be:

1. **Trim trailing newlines on paste** before inserting text.  
2. **Use Shift+Enter** for new lines; only plain Enter sends.  
3. **Guard on send**???strip any leftover newline before submitting.

Myself I thought about using MS PowerToys for this to do on fly replacement, but I was also thinking about another solution that is more advanced (to my level) that will do this automatically by detecting the Terminal window name and thus applying the replacement exclusively to that window without even having to remember anything (sort of set and forget). But I also thought about something like Windows Commander Palette plugin that will sort of type the text and by modifying to replace the new line chars by Ctrl+Enter (I think it can work but I need to test the idea, yet it can be slower than it should to do it this way and also cause all sort of UX undesirable situations.)

Tomorrow hopefully I will try to learn more about this and what would be the best options to have to circumvent this issue, but I hope that Gosling will come up with an elegant solution that will make all my tinkering obsolete.
Quick temporary fix that worked well for me : just **dumbly paste it into your navigator search** bar (Chrome/Firefox), this will remove all line carriage, ctrl+c again and you should be good to go

FYI: https://textcleaner.net/ is a more elegant solution. Or `terminator` etc. as your terminal.

No matter how long the conversation is, it will be truncated by ! . So even if I use the notepad combination, I have to manually replace ! again.

issueDTO.title: feature: document RPC responses in AsyncAPI
issueDTO.description:
### Discussed in https://github.com/airtai/faststream/discussions/1570
Originally posted by **gri38** July 1, 2024 Hello. When we subscribe to a queue to answer a RPC call, it seems we cannot document the return type. H??ere a small exemple: ```python import logging from faststream import FastStream from faststream.rabbit import RabbitBroker from pydantic import BaseModel, conint broker = RabbitBroker() app = FastStream(broker) class In(BaseModel): i: str j: conint(gt=0) class Out(BaseModel): k: str l: float @broker.subscriber("RPC", title="RPC", description="This queue is used to for RPC", ) async def rpc_handler(input: In) -> Out: logging.info(f"{input=}") return Out(k=input.i, l=input.j) ``` If I run with `faststream docs serve rpc:app` I cannot see Out in the doc (http://localhost:8000). Is there a way to do so ? When I use the RabbitRouter, I can see in the router @subscriber decorator: ```python # FastAPI args response_model: Annotated[ Any, Doc( """ The type to use for the response. It could be any valid Pydantic *field* type. So, it doesn't have to be a Pydantic model, it could be other things, like a `list`, `dict`, etc. It will be used for: * Documentation: the generated OpenAPI (and the UI at `/docs`) will show it as the response (JSON Schema). * Serialization: you could return an arbitrary object and the `response_model` would be used to serialize that object into the corresponding JSON. * Filtering: the JSON sent to the client will only contain the data (fields) defined in the `response_model`. If you returned an object that contains an attribute `password` but the `response_model` does not include that field, the JSON sent to the client would not have that `password`. * Validation: whatever you return will be serialized with the `response_model`, converting any data as necessary to generate the corresponding JSON. But if the data in the object returned is not valid, that would mean a violation of the contract with the client, so it's an error from the API developer. So, FastAPI will raise an error and return a 500 error code (Internal Server Error). Read more about it in the [FastAPI docs for Response Model](https://fastapi.tiangolo.com/tutorial/response-model/). """ ), ``` But even with response_model: nothing in asyncAPI. Thanks for any tips, even for "it's not possible" ;-)
comments:
This is the good point. I think, we should document RPC responses if subscriber has no `no_reply=False` option

AsyncAPI 3.0 has a special syntax for that case, but I can't find AsyncAPI 2.6.0 example to figure out how it should looks like
https://www.asyncapi.com/docs/concepts/asyncapi-document/reply-info
Looks useful
I can work with this.
@alexeev-prog thank you! Go ahead!

issueDTO.title: [Feature Request] Keybind to toggle "auto tiling" on and off
issueDTO.description:
Hi @domferr thank you so much for the awesome extension! I have a request/suggestion related to the recently introduced (https://github.com/domferr/tilingshell/issues/169) auto tiling.

Most of the time auto tiling is what I want out of my window manager, but depending on what I'm working on I sometimes don't want it. My specific use case is that I am developing a desktop application that closes and re-spawns its main window as I make changes in the source code and it is helpful if the application window always spawns into the same position and size every time (based on the configuration in my code).

I find myself manually going into the `tiling-shell` extension settings to toggle "auto tiling" off while I'm working on my desktop application, and then going back in and toggling "auto tiling" back on when I am using my computer for non-development work.

It would be great if I could just hit a configurable keybind rather than having to open up the gnome extension settings to toggle this setting.

Thanks for considering, cheers!
comments: Hi, this is a nice addition

issueDTO.title: Use plain text writer for texorpdfstring
comments:
That would involve using something based on `writePlain` instead of `stringify` at
https://github.com/jgm/pandoc/blob/pr-9168/src/Text/Pandoc/Writers/LaTeX.hs#L678-L679

"based on" because `writePlain` converts Pandoc -> Text, not [Inline] -> Text, but something like

``` hs
trim <$> writePlain opts (Pandoc nullMeta [Plain ils])
```
This would have some other advantages, e.g. in some cases unicode super/subscript numerals would be used.  Math would also be handled better, arguably -- when possible it would be rendered using unicode characters.

A possible disadvantage would be performance. But if this is just for headings, it's probably not going to add up to much.
Another disadvantage is that making one writer depend on another makes the code more spaghetti-like.  However, I believe there are already some cases like this in the code base.

I suppose another option would be having an attribute on header elements that is a plain text representation of the header. It would be less automatic, but would make configuring it in filters possible without re-implementing the whole header writer in a raw block.

If the writer were able to take something like:

```
  "blocks": [
    {
      "t": "Header",
      "c": [
        3,
        [
          "test",
          [],
          [
            [
              "plain",
              "example"
            ]
          ]
        ],
....
```
and turn it into:

```
\subsection{\texorpdfstring{Test (\High)}{example}}\label{test}
```

We would no longer have one writer reliant on another. However, users could use a lua filter like:

```
el.attr.attributes.plain = pandoc.write( pandoc.read( content,"markdown" ),"plain")
```

(not tested, likely typo somewhere but you hopefully get the idea)

Precedents for a writer depending on a writer:
OPML writer depends on markdown and html writers
ODT writer depends on opendocument writer
ipynb writer depends on markdown, plain writer
chunkedhtml and epub writers depend on html writer
markdown writer depends on html writer
If we thought that the markdown writer might some day need to depend on the LaTeX writer, that would be a reason for not establishing a dependency the other way.  Otherwise, maybe it's okay?

I think having an attribute allows for the most flexibility when it comes to filters. It also allows users to specify exactly what they want in the original document. In the case of markdown, that might be

```
## Test (\Hard) {plain="test - hard"}
```

This is obviously a slightly contrived example, although I don't really see a disadvantage with this option.

And, I would suppose, there is nothing stopping the latex writer from falling back to depending on plain if the plain attribute isn't present and you want to get the better Maths etc for free (as far as a user is concerned at least)

Yes, it provides more flexibility, but there is a disadvantage: it's not automatic. So, for example, you wouldn't get the improved treatment of math and subscripts noted above.

You're right that we could combine the two approaches.
so, i might have some time in the next few days to work on a PR if you want. would be a good excuse to learn the basics of Haskell. do you have a preference for which route you want to take?

I'm most tempted by the simpler approach of just using the plain writer.
If there's a continuing need for more flexibility, we could consider the other later.

> If we thought that the markdown writer might some day need to depend on the LaTeX writer, that would be a reason for not establishing a dependency the other way. Otherwise, maybe it's okay?

I'm happy with that, although I had a thought about this. Does the markdown writer not depend on the latex writer at all for maths? As in: <https://pandoc.org/MANUAL.html#math>

> Does the markdown writer not depend on the latex writer at all for maths? 

No, it doesn't. Math in pandoc is actually stored in the AST in tex format.  So no conversion is necessary in the writer.

repository.name: pandoc

summary.main: The main goal is to modify the texorpdfstring function to use the plain text writer instead of the stringify function, in order to replace \High with 'High'.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue is to use a plain text writer for texorpdfstring, specifically to replace \High with 'High'.
summary.attemptedFixes: Some possible solutions mentioned include using 'writePlain' instead of 'stringify', adding an attribute on header elements that is a plain text representation of the header, or having the writer take a 'blocks' argument that includes a plain text representation of the header.
summary.otherNotes: There are two possible approaches: using 'writePlain' instead of 'stringify' or adding an attribute on header elements that is a plain text representation of the header. The first approach has some advantages, but may have performance issues and make the code more spaghetti-like. The second approach would be less automatic, but would make configuring it in filters possible without re-implementing the whole header writer in a raw block. There are precedents for a writer depending on another writer, but there is a disadvantage: it's not automatic.

issueDTO.title: Support templating engine in download pages
issueDTO.description:
### GlassFish Version (and build number)

N/A

### JDK version

N/A

### OS

N/A

### Database

_No response_

### Problem Description

After every release, we have to copy&paste and replace text in the info about GlassFish versions. It would help to automate this during the website build process.

The idea here is:
* add templating support to the website resources, so that the build would interpret templating instructions, not only variable references supported by the resources plugin
* replace references to specific GlassFish versions with variables
* redefine a variable with a specific version before each block and then reuse it in the whole block

For example, with velocity engine, it could look like:

```
#set($version = "7.0.24")

GlassFish version $version brings new features...

Download at https://www.eclipse.org/downloads/download.php?file=/ee4j/glassfish/glassfish-$version.zip

#set($version = "7.0.23")

GlassFish version $version brings new features...

Download at https://www.eclipse.org/downloads/download.php?file=/ee4j/glassfish/glassfish-$version.zip

```

Possible options:

* replace the standard maven resources plugin with an existing maven plugin that supports templating, e.g. [MojoHaus Templating Maven Plugin](https://www.mojohaus.org/templating-maven-plugin/)
* create a [custom resource filter](https://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-resources-plugin/examples/custom-resource-filters.html) for the resources plugin that calls velocity or some other templating engine - no such custom resource exists out of the box, we would have to create one and wrap a templating engine

### Steps to reproduce

Happens everytime we update the glassfish.org website after a new GlassFish release.

### Impact of Issue

_No response_
comments:
Under the "eat your own dogfood" mantra, we could use Piranha and Facelets templating for this.

The maven plugin can call piranha easily. It *could* even use the mojarra dependencies that are already on the classpath for a GlassFish build.

Eg

System.out.println(
    new EmbeddedPiranhaBuilder()
        .stringResource("/index.xhtml", """
            <!DOCTYPE html>

            <html lang="en" xmlns:h="http://xmlns.jcp.org/jsf/html">
                <h:head>
                    <title>Hello Jakarta Faces</title>
                </h:head> 
                <h:body>
                    Hello Jakarta Faces
                </h:body>
            </html>
            """)
        .initializer(MojarraInitializer.class)
        .buildAndStart()
        .service("/index.xhtml")
        .getResponseAsString());

https://blogs.oracle.com/javamagazine/post/you-dont-always-need-an-application-server-to-run-jakarta-ee-applications

Hello @OndroMih, I'm a new guy to this repo, searching for `good first issues` though, with a background of just `Spring framework`, `Hibernate` other related libraries, I feel like there's a missing building block for me to contribute to this repo.
May you please advise me on the concepts I have to acquaint myself with to truly get a deeper understanding of this repository?

On the other hand, please assign me this issue so I can work on it as I'm being mentored along the way.
Thanks!

> On the other hand, please assign me this issue so I can work on it

You can work on it without being assigned. Just do it and offer PR for review.

Hello, @Ariho-Seth , this issue is more about improving the build of the website and possibly creating a helper Maven plugin to support templating in the source code of the website. If you'd like to try it, I can mentor you a bit. But if you don't like tinkering with the build and Maven, maybe there's a better issue for you to pick up.

In any case, the best thing to do for a start is building GlassFish itself. You can find some help about it in the build section of the [README file](https://github.com/eclipse-ee4j/glassfish?tab=readme-ov-file#building)

Then, if you decided to investigate this issue, it's good to start with building the website locally. There's no documentation for this I think, I should write something about it. Right now, I can share my script that I execute to run a preview of the page locally. I use this script on Ubuntu Linux with zsh shell:

```
GLASSFISH_REPO=../glassfish
GF_DOCS_DIR="$GLASSFISH_REPO"/docs/publish/target/staging

# Build all docs artifacts (PDFs and HTML)
#mvn -f "$GLASSFISH_REPO"/docs/pom.xml -T4C clean install

mvn -f "$GLASSFISH_REPO"/docs/pom.xml -T4C -pl website,distribution -Ppublish-site clean install
mvn -f "$GLASSFISH_REPO"/docs/publish/pom.xml clean install


echo "source 'https://rubygems.org'
gem 'github-pages', group: :jekyll_plugins
gem 'jekyll-theme-eclipsefdn'
gem 'webrick'
gem 'jekyll-toc'
" > "$GF_DOCS_DIR"/Gemfile

sed -i 's!remote_theme: eclipsefdn/jekyll-theme-eclipsefdn!theme: jekyll-theme-eclipsefdn!' "$GF_DOCS_DIR"/_config.yml

grep repository "$GF_DOCS_DIR"/_config.yml > /dev/null || echo '\nrepository: eclipse-ee4j/glassfish' >> "$GF_DOCS_DIR"/_config.yml

bundle install --gemfile "$GF_DOCS_DIR"/Gemfile

zsh -c "cd $GF_DOCS_DIR; bundle exec jekyll serve --incremental"
# run `bundle exec jekyll serve` in GF_DOCS_DIR   
```

Instead of zsh you can use bash, or just type the `cd $GF_DOCS_DIR; bundle exec jekyll serve --incremental` command in the terminal manually. The `sed` and `grep` commands update the _config.yml file to point to a local theme and correct repository.
And you need to install Ruby, sorry :-)

There are comments and discussions about the script used to run the website locally, and the contributor is having issues running the script.

issueDTO.title: Feature Request: Per-Monitor Layout List + Orientation-Aware Rendering
issueDTO.description: **Description:** Thanks for the great extension! In a dual-monitor setup (one landscape, one portrait), the current global **Layout list** does not allow to customize per-monitor usage. I???d like to: **Requests:** 1. **Allow separate Layout lists per monitor**, so I can choose horizontal layouts on the landscape display and vertical ones on the portrait one. 2. **Optionally**, detect the monitor's orientation (portrait vs. landscape) and render layout previews accordingly, so aspect ratios and proportions reflect the actual screen. This would improve both usability and clarity when working with mixed-orientation monitors.
comments:
Hey, thank you for opening this.

> Allow separate Layout lists per monitor

Isn't it already implemented, like on your screenshot?

> Optionally, detect the monitor's orientation (portrait vs. landscape) and render layout previews accordingly

Yeah, improving the layout buttons to reflect monitor's orientation would be nice. It is not really hard to implement, I am open to anyone who wants to contribute on this!

repository.description: Extend Gnome Shell with advanced tiling window management. Supports multiple monitors, Windows 11 Snap Assistant, Fancy Zones, customised tiling layouts and more.
repository.name: tilingshell

summary.main: Implement feature request for per-monitor layout list and orientation-aware rendering in the tilingshell extension.
summary.validationOrRequirement: Separate layout lists per monitor and optional orientation-aware rendering, with a focus on usability and clarity when working with mixed-orientation monitors.
summary.attemptedFixes: The commenter has mentioned that the separate layout lists per monitor might already be implemented, and the orientation-aware rendering is considered a nice-to-have improvement.
summary.otherNotes: Issue involves a dual-monitor setup with one landscape and one portrait monitor, with a request for separate layout lists per monitor and optional orientation-aware rendering.

issueDTO.title: Mobile Phone validations - For The First Time Contributors
issueDTO.description:
I would like to give this to the people who are new and would like to start contributing to validator.js.

The current version in `isMobilePhone validation`, we have less than 195 phone validations i.e

In the code https://github.com/validatorjs/validator.js/blob/master/src/lib/isMobilePhone.js, the validations exist from line 5 to line 119, which means we have probably 119 - 5 countries phone validations. Where might be other countries? That is up to someone who would like to choose which country does not exist and create a new validation for the same. 

When making this change, apart from the file above, also add tests and update the isMobilePhone section in the README.

Also, please check on existing PR's if the country you choose to validate mobile phone numbers does not have an already PR raised.

All Prs are welcomed and we will do a review on the same
comments:
Great catch, please do add @mairagee524 and reference your PR to this issue with the correct title such as 
`phone number for Mexico(code)` etc.

Thanks and looking forward to your PR. 
I will also double-check on the same.

issueDTO.title: Allow directly opening files/folders instead of containing folder in tray search
issueDTO.description:
<!--- Please keep this note for other contributors -->

### How to use GitHub

* Please use the 👍 [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are interested into the same feature.
* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.

---

## Feature request

**Which Nextcloud Version are you currently using:** (see administration page)
3.15.3 Windows version.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I have a folder containing a lot of folders with similar names that I need to manually sort and look through so I would like to search them. I disabled Windows search indexing on my Nextcloud directory because windows kept on downloading files I wanted to only keep online every time I searched for something in the parent folder.

The search function in the Nextcloud tray menu is able to find the desired sub folder, but clicking the folder only opens the containing folder and not the folder itself. This is useless to me because, as said, there are a lot of different folders and the folder names are too similar.

It looks like Nextcloud just opens the containing folder for folders or files. It would be nice if there was at least a context open to allow opening folder or files.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Open folder or file by default and have open containing folder the context menu option, but that risks messing with other people's workflow since open containing folder is the current behavior.
comments: Thanks for the feedback, we will look into improving this.

Currently this feature works as @mijioij wants it to work (as far as I am aware of).

My folders are structured as follows
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cce6c3a6-96a0-408d-a99e-1a78aa013608)

And when I search I get
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/57c1c6ec-cfed-40be-a3a4-ef00c73cca89)

Upon clicking I am redirected into the folder I clicked on
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cd7ccc4f-1edd-4e7b-8893-71def69ec3f2)

Is this how you (@mijioij) wanted it to be? Or did I misunderstand?

@mike0609king That isn't the location in the tray I am talking about. It's the search results after searching an item with the tray menu's search function, not the folder listing under the standard file sync in the tray menu settings. 

Side note: When I click a folder under the standard file sync tab, it opens in windows explorer and doesn't open a browser like your example suggests.
@mijioij I am not sure what you mean in that case. Could you show me a screenshot?

@mijioij Thanks for the quick response. I am sure, that I use the same search tray above. Maybe it has been fixed on the current version. Which version are you using? 

EDIT: I will also try it out again and take a look at the code for this.

@mike0609king The pictures you showed are only when you right click tray icon -> settings. I got to the screenshot I showed when I right click the tray icon -> Open main dialog -> enter search term in the search box and search.

I am using version 3.16.6 stable.

The difference was the Nextcloud version. It seems that the file explorer only opens in Nextcloud 20, because of the different file format for the `resourceUrl`. As far as I am aware we only have that file format
```
https://<url>/index.php/apps/files/?dir=<dir>&scrollto=<dirname>
```
in Nextcloud 20. The other ones send the file path in a separate attribute.

I would then implement the context menu and resolve the bug with the links in this issue.

@mike0609king It wasn't clear from your comment, is this issue due to behavior from the nextcloud server and you will only fix the bug to work with the newer server or will you fix the bug for compatibility with the older server?
@mijioij It will be fixed for both.

@allexzander (original author) or @camilasan, is the currently implemented behavior under nextcloud server version 20 the standard/intended one?
By that I mean the behavior the OP described. We want to open ".../folder/subfolder" directly in our file explorer, but when searching for it in the traymenu search bar and clicking on "subfolder" the containing folder ".../folder" opens. 
From the implementation it seems to me as if this was indeed intended by the deliberate use of `QFileInfo(relativePath).path()` instead of simply `relativePath` as an argument to `findFileInLocalFolders` when initializing `localFiles` in _src/gui/tray/unifiedsearchresultlistmodel.cpp_ line 340. 
However in the web browser the clicked folder or file is directly opened, rather than the containing folder (currently the case for server versions above 20)

I ask because I am currently working on a fix for this alongside mike and in case the behavior where the containing folder is opened is the desired standard behavior then we would try to implement the behavior requested by OP as a selectable option. Otherwise we would simply make it the default behavior and fix the web browser bug for versions above 20.

issueDTO.title: Add READMEs to all block-editor components
issueDTO.description:
The Block Editor package in Gutenberg is full of components used to build blocks or block editors. These components lack documentation. This issue is a tracking issue for the documentation effort to add READMEs to all these components. If you want to help with this: - Grab [a component in the block-editor package](https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/tree/master/packages/block-editor/src/components) that lacks a README - Comment on the issue that you want to help document this component - Write a README.md file for this component following the same format as the already documented components. --- Updated by @t-hamano If someone works on this issue, in addition to adding a README file, it would be great if we could also add JSDoc. [The block editor package reference](https://developer.wordpress.org/block-editor/reference-guides/packages/packages-block-editor/) is generated with a JSDoc reference for each component. Components that don't have JSDoc will look like this in the reference: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/825314c7-526f-4ed8-9603-3d3ee9012b3d) The recommended complete JSDoc format should look like this: ```jsx /** * Component description here. * * @see https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/blob/HEAD/packages/block-editor/src/components/my-component/README.md * * @example * ```jsx * function MyComponent() { * return ( * * ); * } * ``` * * @param {Object} props Component props. * @param {string} props.prop1 props description here. * @param {Array} props.prop2 props description here. * @return {Element} My component control. */ export default function MyComponent( { prop1, prop2, } ) { return (
My Component
); } ```
comments: I want to make a README for the block-alignment-matrix-toolbar, issue #22516 ; How should I proceed? Is this a README for the issue or for the component?

@alita-moore yes, a README is needed for that component. so you should add a file to the component folder name it README.md, copy some existing component README to get the "base  template" and fill it.

Okay,

[This README](https://www.github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/tree/master/packages%2Fblock-editor%2Fsrc%2Fcomponents%2Fautocomplete%2FREADME.md)

Doesn't have a very defined structure. Are you saying to copy the format in terms of linking to the parent directory?
Yes, this is not the best example. This might work better https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/blob/master/packages/components/src/button/README.md

Oh okay, that's much better.

Thank you for info, I'll get cracking 👩???💻

I would like to help but it has been difficult for me to figure out which of these are actionable.
I think the highest priority ones are the ones that are exported and don't have any `__experimental` prefix.

For reference, The `README.md` at [https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/blob/trunk/packages/block-editor/src/components/alignment-control/README.md](https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/blob/trunk/packages/block-editor/src/components/alignment-control/README.md) is a good model to follow for the rest of the components
Just thought I'd mention that I have a few months of leave coming up, so won't be able to work on these for a while. I notice I was assigned a few.
Hi @talldan, please feel free to re-assign those to someone else that you deem has the technical knowledge required to create the readme. Thanks.
Can guide me on how to start or just go with the example from the other documented components, such as this one for button? Thanks!

@0x8sksr There are many components in [the `block-editor` directory](https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/tree/trunk/packages/block-editor/src/components) that already have READMEs, so you can use those as a reference.

For components that are used in Block Supports would it be a good idea include a suggestion for that API? For example, `SpacingSizesControl` could point out that [Spacing support](https://developer.wordpress.org/block-editor/reference-guides/block-api/block-supports/#spacing) may facilitate their use case. The only concern I can think of might be if the block supports switches to a different control it would make the suggestion incorrect so including such suggestions is more maintenance burden.

A issue with the guidance to follow the format of existing READMEs is that not all aren???t consistent. The biggest difference I find is that some include "Development guidelines" as a heading above "Usage" and "Props". I thought the point should be raised to settle on a more specific guidance. My feeling is the "Development guidelines" heading should be avoided in the future. If so, we could also remove that from existing READMEs that have it. I didn???t see way to get a URL for the exact search but here???s the query that can be pasted in to search:
```
repo:WordPress/gutenberg path:/^packages\/block-editor\/src\/components\//  language:Markdown /#+ Development guidelines/
```

Hi

A suggestion to put this issue on hold was brought up in the [WordPress Slack channel (account needed)](https://wordpress.slack.com/archives/C02QB2JS7/p1741239852974279).

Currently there are 149 developer documentation pull requests open that are awaiting review, from 2021 and later.
https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/pulls?q=is%3Apr+is%3Aopen+label%3A%22%5BType%5D+Developer+Documentation%22+review%3Anone

Before opening new pull requests for this issue please consider reviewing one of the existing pull requests.

Another idea is to arrange regular scrubs where these pull requests are reviewed, so that they do not continue to become stale/ out of date.

The issue is to grab a component in the block-editor package, comment on the issue, and write a README.md file for the component following the same format as the already documented components. Additionally, JSDoc is recommended for each component.

issueDTO.title: socks proxy support
issueDTO.description:
### Feature request description

Hi. I'm trying to run ramalama from China, where most of the free internet is only accessible over a proxy. Naive attempts to invoke a proxy with all_proxy fail:
```
$ export all_proxy="socks5h://localhost:1080"
```
```
$ ramalama rag ~/test.md localhost/test.md
Converting test.md.pdf .   2025-07-24 11:18:52.081 | ERROR    | fastembed.common.model_management:download_model:430 - Could not download model from HuggingFace: (ProtocolError('Connection aborted.', ConnectionResetError(104, 'Connection reset by peer')), '(Request ID: b19d6dd2-5b1f-40d3-9670-d54511639529)') Falling back to other sources.
2025-07-24 11:18:52.081 | ERROR    | fastembed.common.model_management:download_model:452 - Could not download model from either source, sleeping for 3.0 seconds, 2 retries left.
...
```

It would be great to have support for a socks proxy (actually socks5h, so that the DNS queries are also proxied).

### Suggest potential solution

_No response_

### Have you considered any alternatives?

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_
comments: Interested in opening a PR to add support?
I can take a look, but I don't really have an idea how it would be done best. Perhaps if all downloads were made with curl, proxies would just work, but is it sensible to change everything to curl?

> I can take a look, but I don't really have an idea how it would be done best. Perhaps if all downloads were made with curl, proxies would just work, but is it sensible to change everything to curl?

Short answer, sadly no it is not sensible to change everything to curl...
Googling this says that Python should be supporting ALL_PROXY out of the box with the http calls.
What version of RamaLama are  you using?

> What version of RamaLama are you using?

0.11.1

For me, googling shows that urllib.request needs a little bit persuasion to work with socks proxies:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/63970912/urllib-request-with-socks5-proxy

A short example from an AI (not verified) is:
```python
import sockslib
import socket
import urllib.request

sockslib.set_default_proxy(('127.0.0.1', 1080))
socket.socket = sockslib.SocksSocket

html = urllib.request.urlopen('https://huggingface.co').read()
```

This works (with pysocks):
```python
import socks
import socket
import urllib.request

socks.set_default_proxy(socks.SOCKS5, 127.0.0.1, 1080)
socket.socket = socks.socksocket

resp = urllib.request.urlopen('https://ifconfig.co/ip')
print(resp.read().decode())
```

But I'm not sure how to make it work in ramalama. I tried editing https://github.com/containers/ramalama/blob/main/ramalama/http_client.py but without any luck yet
@ericcurtin Thoughts?

A short test with this file:
```python
import urllib.request

resp = urllib.request.urlopen('https://ifconfig.co/country')
print(resp.read().decode())
```
and an http/https/socks5 proxy on port 1080.

```
$ python proxy-test.py 
China
```

```
$ all_proxy="socks5h://127.0.0.1:1080" python proxy-test.py 
China
```

```
$ https_proxy="127.0.0.1:1080" python proxy-test.py 
Germany
```

So `urllib.request` picks up an https proxy but does not pick up a socks proxy. The https proxies have a very limited use in China because dns lookup of forbidden websites (like huggingface) is poisoned, and we have to use a socks5h proxy so that the dns lookups go through it
Any idea on how to work around this?

issueDTO.title: [Feature request] Synchronise window border color with GNOME accent color
issueDTO.description:
GNOME 47 introduced 9 accent-colors to choose from in the Settings:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/99eb03bc-7cee-460e-aa11-257dc8aae562)

https://release.gnome.org/47/

It would be nice to be able to synchronise the window border color with GNOME's accent color automatically. I'm currently doing it manually, it is not difficult to do, but it would be amazing to have it done directly by your extension!
This [page](https://gnome.pages.gitlab.gnome.org/libadwaita/doc/main/styles-and-appearance.html#accent-color) may help for background implementation since you're using libadwaita. It would probably also require to add a toggle button in the Preferences page in the [Window border section](https://github.com/domferr/tilingshell/blob/77cc572dc550d10b2f1819fd9a2805fdaa86cb27/src/prefs.ts#L111).

If you want to go even further, there are also extensions to [customise the desktop accent color like Custom Accent Colors](https://extensions.gnome.org/extension/5547/custom-accent-colors/) or even to [synchronise it with the wallpaper dominant color like Auto accent colour](https://extensions.gnome.org/extension/7502/auto-accent-colour/). I don't know they work and if that means a lot of work to support their implementation.
comments: Hey, thank you for sharing this. It is a great idea!
Hi there and greetings. Is there any progress on this ?
Hi @EdiDD, unfortunately I had no time to work on it yet. I am open to anyone who wants to contribute! Feel free to comment here and I'll provide full support!

Hey @domferr, I'd like to start working on this feature and it would be great to have a feedback from early ideas and potential implementation.

By the way I've never use TypeScript/JavaScript, but I did a lot of C/C++/Python/Rust so even if I'm ok doing this, feel free to make any comments as there may be some TypeScript-specific concepts I'm not aware of !

### UI side

I was thinking about:

- adding a toggle between `Width` and `Border color` called `Automatic border color`
- renaming `Border color` to `Custom border color`

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0a02259c-e745-4640-8494-03849352e624)

The extension would then automatically synchronize the color with the global accent color when the toggle is activated, or use the custom border color when deactivated.

### Backend side

Some settings would be added/modified:

- add a new setting called `WINDOW_BORDER_COLOR_AUTO` (or some other variant name if you prefer) that would hold the toggle state and would be register in the gschema
- rename `WINDOW_BORDER_COLOR` to `WINDOW_BORDER_COLOR_CUSTOM`
- add a new setting called `WINDOW_BORDER_COLOR` that would return `WINDOW_BORDER_COLOR_CUSTOM` or the global accent color based on `WINDOW_BORDER_COLOR_AUTO` state

Here I differenciate the general color from the custom color, so the previously user-defined color isn't overwritten when auto coloring is used.

Looking at [GNOME-Auto-Accent-Color implementation](https://github.com/Wartybix/GNOME-Auto-Accent-Colour/blob/10ee080c75be09038c2d13f635b75ae9e93f81e5/extension.js#L356), it looks like it's a simple call to `Gio.Settings({ schema: INTERFACE_SCHEMA }).get_string(ACCENT_COLOR)`.
Plus some [signal management](https://github.com/Wartybix/GNOME-Auto-Accent-Colour/blob/10ee080c75be09038c2d13f635b75ae9e93f81e5/extension.js#L529) when the accent color is changed after startup.

What do you think about this ?

Hey, first of all, thank you so much! 

Your idea of changing the current WINDOW_BORDER_COLOR to return WINDOW_BORDER_COLOR_CUSTOM or the global accent color based on WINDOW_BORDER_COLOR_AUTO state is a cool idea!

## How Tiling Shell stores the window border color setting

What you see in the preferences window is a pair, the setting key and its value. The key is stored in [`Settings.KEY_WINDOW_BORDER_COLOR`](https://github.com/domferr/tilingshell/blob/c12f6eecde7279aed0bf5dd8e3631c2551afe068/src/settings/settings.ts#L81). It must match with the key specified in Tiling Shell gschema [here](https://github.com/domferr/tilingshell/blob/c12f6eecde7279aed0bf5dd8e3631c2551afe068/resources/schemas/org.gnome.shell.extensions.tilingshell.gschema.xml#L135).

To add a new setting (for example the boolean you called `WINDOW_BORDER_COLOR_AUTO`) you can follow the guide I wrote [here](https://github.com/domferr/tilingshell/blob/main/README.md#how-to-add-new-keybindings) but just the steps 1 and 2.

## How Tiling Shell shows the window border color

The management of window border is in [`WindowBorderManager`](https://github.com/domferr/tilingshell/blob/c12f6eecde7279aed0bf5dd8e3631c2551afe068/src/components/windowBorderManager.ts#L382) class. [Here](https://github.com/domferr/tilingshell/blob/c12f6eecde7279aed0bf5dd8e3631c2551afe068/src/components/windowBorderManager.ts#L350) is where I set the border color according to the user setting. The class `Settings` has the goal to make extremely easy (like one line of code) to get and set the settings and listen to the user changes of the setting. It exposes a static field for each setting and its getter and setter (like [here](https://github.com/domferr/tilingshell/blob/c12f6eecde7279aed0bf5dd8e3631c2551afe068/src/settings/settings.ts#L361-L367)) gets/sets the value from/to Gio.Settings.

## GNOME's accent color setting

From your link, then, I can say that it looks like GNOME 47+ stores the accent color to the schema `org.gnome.desktop.interface`, with key `accent-color`. I don't have GNOME 47 so it might be worth to double check if you can! (using tools like dconf or getting the key value from terminal, let me know if you need help on this)

## Signal management: listen to `accent-color` changes

Having that association there is awesome! In Tiling Shell there is already another example of signal management to listen to changes of `Gio.Settings` keys, have a look [here](https://github.com/domferr/tilingshell/blob/c12f6eecde7279aed0bf5dd8e3631c2551afe068/src/extension.ts#L170C9-L173)! Something like this then:

```
this._signals.connect(
            new Gio.Settings({ schema: 'org.gnome.desktop.interface' }),
            'changed::accent-color',
            (_interfaceSettings: Gio.Settings) => {
                    ... this code here is executed when the accent-color key changes its value
            }
);
```

`_signals` is an object of class [`SignalHandling`](https://github.com/domferr/tilingshell/blob/main/src/utils/signalHandling.ts#L7) which I created to have a class that simplifies connecting and disconnecting to signals. You can find it already used in WindowBorderManager class.

## Add a new setting in the preferences

All the code of the preferences window is in `src/prefs.ts` file.

## How to react to the user enabling or disabling the use of the accent color

You need to listen via signals to changes in the settings. [Here](https://github.com/domferr/tilingshell/blob/c12f6eecde7279aed0bf5dd8e3631c2551afe068/src/components/windowBorderManager.ts#L415-L417) for example, I listen to changes the user makes to the window border color setting (e.g. from the preferences window).
```
this._signals.connect(Settings, Settings.KEY_WINDOW_BORDER_COLOR, () =>
            this._border?.updateStyle(),
);
```
In the code above I listen to changes in the Settings (e.g. changes made from Tiling Shell's preferences window). Specifically, I listen to changes of the key `KEY_WINDOW_BORDER_COLOR`. If it changes then the following function is run 
```
() =>
            this._border?.updateStyle(),
)
```
(this is similar to C++ lambda functions!)
You can do a similar thing but with something like `KEY_WINDOW_BORDER_COLOR_AUTO`.

To simplify, I can think of those steps:
1. Add in Tiling Shell's gschema a new setting with key `window-border-color-auto` which value is a boolean and default value is false
2. Update class Settings to introduce KEY_WINDOW_BORDER_COLOR_AUTO and getter/setter of WINDOW_BORDER_COLOR_AUTO. This returns/sets a boolean, which defaults to false in case of any error. You can follow other boolean settings in the Settings class
3. Listen to KEY_WINDOW_BORDER_COLOR_AUTO changes in WindowBorderManager class (like we listen to changes of KEY_WINDOW_BORDER_COLOR)
4. In WindowBorderManager class, listen to GNOME's `accent-color` changes to update the style of the border (like we listen to changes of KEY_WINDOW_BORDER_COLOR)
5. Update `src/prefs.ts` file to add a new row in the preferences window to with your new flag `Automatic border color`

Reach me out for anything you may need! Feel free to open a pull request whenever you want

Thanks for all the indications, they are really valuable and I truly appreciate them !

This doesn't seem too difficult so I think I'll come back in a few days/weeks with a working solution in a PR. 😄
Hey @vinchatl did you manage to implement this? I'd love to give this update to everybody, let me know if you are working on it so I don't begin the development myself 😎

issueDTO.title: Simplify maybe_flush_rewrites() method
issueDTO.description:
### Is your enhancement related to a problem? Please describe.

The current implementation of automated checks to see if it might be necessary to flush the rewrite rules is ok and working, but could be improved.

### Designs

Instead of setting an own` do_flush_the_rules` option to check against, GatherPress could rely on WordPress core functionality to re-create the rewrite rules on the fly, if they don???t exist. 

This is happening early on each request and checks for the existence of the `rewrite_rules` option.

I suggest that GatherPress _just_ delete the `rewrite_rules` core option, if the rules need to be flushed.
And let WordPress handle the rest.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct
comments: PING @mauteri

issueDTO.title: Expect.toBeInRange
issueDTO.description:
*Platform* (all, jvm, js): all
*Extension* (none, kotlin 1.3): none

## Code related feature
```kotlin
expect(x).toBeInRange(1..10)
expect(x).toBeInRange(1 until 10)

//instead of

expect(x) {
  toBeGreaterThanOrEqualTo(1)
  toBeLessThanOrEqualTo(10)
}
expect(x) {
  toBeGreaterThanOrEqualTo(1)
  toBeLessThan(10)
}
```

Following the things you need to do:

*logic*
- [x] create RangeAssertions with a function `toBeInRange` (see e.g. FloatingPointAssertions as a guideline)
- [x] implement toBeInRange in DefaultRangeAssertions.kt - make sure both bounds are evaluated (no fail fast behaviour)
- [x] execute `./gradlew generateLogic` this will generate accessors based on your interface
- [ ] execute `./gradlew apiDump & KOTLIN_VERSION=1.9 ./gradlew apiDump`


*api-fluent*
- [x] create rangeExpectations.kt with 3 times fun `Expect<T>.toBeInRange(t: T): Expect<T>` for T= CharRange, IntRange, LongRange
- [ ] create a Test named AbstractRangeExpectationsSpec in atrium-specs -> commonMain  (see for instance AbstractComparableExpectationsTest) and extend it in atrium-api-fluent -> commonTest (name it RangeExpectationsSpec)
- [ ] create RangeExpectationSamples.kt with 3 functions in commonTest -> samples (see other samples as guideline -- try to provide the reason why an expectation fails)
- [x] add `@sample` with link to your sample method to the 3 functions in rangeExpectations.kt
- [x] add `@since 1.3.0` (adapt to current [milestone](https://github.com/robstoll/atrium/milestones)) to KDOC of the three functions in RangeExpectations.kt
- [ ] execute `./gradlew apiDump & KOTLIN_VERSION=1.9 ./gradlew apiDump`


*api-infix*
- [ ] create rangeExpectations.kt with 3 times fun `Expect<T>.toBeInRange(t: T): Expect<T>` for T= CharRange, IntRange, LongRange
- [ ] create RangeExpectationsTest in atrium-api-infix which extends AbstractRangeExpectationsSpec
- [ ] add samples to RangeExpectationSamples.kt (3 fun again)
- [ ] add `@sample` with link to your sample method to the 3 functions in rangeExpectations.kt
- [ ] add `@since 1.3.0` (adapt to current [milestone](https://github.com/robstoll/atrium/milestones)) to KDOC of the two functions in RangeExpectations.kt
- [ ] execute `./gradlew apiDump & KOTLIN_VERSION=1.9 ./gradlew apiDump`

## Your first contribution?
- Write a comment `I'll work on this` if you would like to take this issue over. 
  This way we get the chance to revise the description in case things have changed in the meantime, we might give you additional hints and we can assign the task to you, so that others do not start as well.
- See [Your first code contribution](https://github.com/robstoll/atrium/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#your-first-code-contribution) for guidelines.  
- Do not hesitate to ask questions here or to contact us via [Atrium's slack channel](https://kotlinlang.slack.com/team/U3DE1TXKP) if you need help
  ([Invite yourself](https://slack.kotlinlang.org/) in case you do not have an account yet).
comments:
Hi @robstoll , I'll work on this
I???ve made a few OSS contributions before, but I still consider myself a beginner ??? I???d really appreciate your support if anything needs fixing!

We don't yet support bytes.

issueDTO.title: Support for command line options
issueDTO.description:
Currently the Session Desktop exevutable appears to support no command line options. In order to get the version of Session, the user has to launch the Session GUI.

Support for command line options may be good to add. To get an idea of the utility of supporting command line options, here are some example hypothetical options:

- Print help (typically `-h` or `--help`)
- Print version (typically `-V` or `--version`)
- Verbose output (typically `-v` or `--verbose`)
- Suppress or reduce output (typically `-q` or `--quiet`)
- Start a fresh profile with a generated recovery phrase
- Start a fresh profile with a specified recovery phrase
- Specify the profile directory path (default: `$HOME/.config/Session`)
- Launch Session in offline mode
comments:
A basic no frills text CLI with maybe vt52-vt100 terminal emulation like in the old Unix days. The BBS never died.
Maybe ANSI colors and extended text on monitors beyond 80x25 or 132 x50 ?
3270 terminal emulation for the geeks from IBM out there like me?

How avbout options for duress/purge and erase the client. (Nuke and pave) ? -kill -killW(kill and wipe) -killWP (Kill, wipe, and purge client)

I think that would be a great idea, especially the logs/debug/verbose part.
Would be nice to also ask from the UI to restart session with verbose output for the next start. So we can have more details when we need the user top send more.
The other arguments (start with seed/empty) could also be helpful for our automation tests
It would also be nice to have an argument to start the app minimized.  I'm assuming there isn't one already.

> It would also be nice to have an argument to start the app minimized. I'm assuming there isn't one already.

I was also looking for an argument to start the app minimized but found none.

issueDTO.title: [Enhancement] Fix Non-Functional Navigation Links and Implement Basic Routing System
issueDTO.description:
Issue Description:

 **Problem**
The CodeClip application currently has a polished landing page but suffers from completely non-functional navigation. All header navigation links (`Home`, `Challenges`, `Editor`, `Profile`) point to `#` placeholders, and the main CTA buttons link to non-existent routes (`/coding`, `/challenges`). This makes the application unusable beyond the landing page and creates a poor user experience.

### Current Issues
- ??? Navigation links in header are dummy links (`href="#"`)
- ??? CTA buttons point to `/coding` and `/challenges` routes that don't exist
- ??? No routing system implemented to handle page navigation
- ??? Users cannot access any functionality beyond the homepage

### Proposed Solution
Implement a basic client-side routing system and create the essential pages:

1. **Fix Navigation Links**
   - Update header navigation to point to actual pages/routes
   - Ensure CTA buttons lead to functional destinations

2. **Create Missing Essential Pages**
   - `pages/challenges.html` - Basic challenge listing page

issueDTO.title: NodeEngine: Support HTTPS Cluster Handshake
issueDTO.description:
## Short
The NodeEngine should support sending a HTTPS register request to the cluster manager.

## Proposal
When the NodeEngine sends the handshake request to the cluster manager it should optionally use the https protocol [here](https://github.com/oakestra/oakestra/blob/30b9ebf34f1cdc2dc4b171f74d2240bebe5f9133/go_node_engine/requests/ClusterManagerRequests.go#L26).
This should not however be the default option as this will not be the case for experimental setups.
When starting the NodeEngine this should be enabled with a flag.

## Ratio
Essential for public facing clusters

## Impact
NodeEngine

## Development time
1 Week

## Status
Needs to be implemented

## Checklist
 
- [x] Discussed
- [ ] Documented
- [ ] Implemented
- [ ] Tested

issueDTO.title: Tab in the last text field in a tab should focus the next tab in the tabs of the entry editor.
issueDTO.description:
Follow up to https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/pull/11886

Refs https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/11785
comments: Hi - I would like to be assigned to this issue please. Thank you!

### Guidance on Completing Issue

Hello,

I am currently working on this issue with @juliusalberto  and I'm a bit stuck. Specifically, I need help with the following:

1. **Finding where JabRef handles tab key events**:
   - I am not sure which part of the codebase is responsible for handling the tab key navigation within the Entry Editor. Could you provide guidance on where I should look for the relevant logic? (e.g., which file or class deals with tab key handling or keyboard navigation?)
   
2. **Implementing the tab key behavior**:
   - Once I locate the correct file, where would it be best to add the logic that moves focus to the next tab when pressing `Tab` in the last field of a tab? Should this be handled as part of an existing focus traversal policy, or would I need to implement a custom listener?

Any pointers or advice on these two points would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you for your help.
We do not know. Create a minimal JavaFX application with two tabs and check how it works there. Then port this knowledge to JabRef.

### JavaFX Key Handling and Focus Issue

Hello,

After exploring the codebase, I???ve learned how to check if a `TextField` in a `Tab` is the last one, and how to shift the focus to the next tab. However, I???ve encountered an issue with how JavaFX handles key events when a `TextField` is focused.

For example, if I create a listener for a `TextField` or even the `EntryEditor`, the listener won't execute while the `TextField` is in focus, as the `TextField` consumes the input before it reaches the listener/handler. This issue is currently evident with the `setupKeyBindings` function, which is intended to initialize shortcuts for navigating the entry editor. Only the "Ctrl + MINUS" key seems to work due to what I think is JavaFX handling key inputs before `setupKeyBindings` can.

I???ve tried using `addEventFilter` instead of `addEventHandler`, but the result is the same. I???ve also explored using JavaFX???s `tabIndex` and focus priority logic to control the order of focus between tabs and fields. So that pressing "tab" will cycle through all of the specified components in order. However, since the `Tab` class doesn???t have built-in `tabIndex` or `focusTraversal` properties, this has proven to be quite a challenge.

I???m unsure how to proceed or where I should be focusing my efforts. Any suggestions or guidance would be greatly appreciated thankyou.

> I???m unsure how to proceed or where I should be focusing my efforts. Any suggestions or guidance would be greatly appreciated thankyou.

1. Create a minimal JavaFX application showing the issue. Even smaller application than https://github.com/Siedlerchr/javafxreproducer.
2. Publish the JavaFX application in a repository on GitHub.
3. Ask question on [Stackoverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/).
4. Post the link to the stackoverflow question here.

---

Your text did not include a link to `org.jabref.gui.fieldeditors.FieldEditorFX#establishBinding`. Did you see this method? 


```java
    if (keyBindingRepository.matches(e, {key-for-TAB})) {
```

We have no key binding configuration for tab-to-next field. Which is OK. Just hard-code TAB.

> Your text did not include a link to `org.jabref.gui.fieldeditors.FieldEditorFX#establishBinding`. Did you see this method?

Ah! Good to know. I implemented this feature by setting up a method in ` FieldEditorFX`  that moves the `TabPane` to the next tab if the user presses "Tab" while in the last `TextField` of the current tab. I created a method in `EntryEditor` that checks if the current `TextField` in focus is the last one by comparing its ID with the `Tab`'s  last `Field`'s name. Previously, each `TextField` didn???t have an ID set, so I updated this by setting each ID to the name of its original `Field`.

**Reasons for this approach:**
1. **EntryEditor context requirement:** We can't directly check if the current `Field` in focus is the last without `EntryEditor` context. Because of the way `TextFields` are created, we can???t directly locate the last `TextField` of a `Tab`, but we can easily identify the last `Field` in a tab. To bridge this gap, I assigned IDs to each `TextField` based on their original `Field` names, allowing for comparison.
2. **Adheres to Field creation policy:** This approach adapts to changes in the last `TextField` depending on the active `Tab`, as all `TextFields` are initially created as `Fields`. Because each `TextField` is linked to a corresponding `Field` (with its ID matching the field's name), and the last field in a tab can always be identified through the `shownFields` method, all `TextField`s can be checked as the last `TextField`.

**Alternative approach:** Another way to address this issue could be to modify the focus traversal list, so pressing "Tab" while a `TextField` is in focus cycles through the fields until reaching the last one, then moves to the next `Tab`. However, after spending a short while exploring this option it shows its challenges.

If you???re happy with this implementation, I can create a PR for you to review. Thank you!

Hello, 
I have created a PR [#12087](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/pull/12087) for review. 
Thank you.
Hi! I would like to work on this issue. Can you please assign it to me? Thank you!

No worries, it happens to the best of us. Give it a read, and you???ll discover the ancient wisdom of assigning issues to yourself. Trust me, it???s worth it. 🚀

No worries, it happens to the best of us. Give it a read, and you???ll discover the ancient wisdom of assigning issues to yourself. Trust me, it???s worth it. 🚀

👋 Hey @ruarijupp, thank you for your interest in this issue! 🎉

We're excited to have you on board. Start by exploring our [Contributing](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) guidelines, and don't forget to check out our [workspace setup guidelines](https://devdocs.jabref.org/getting-into-the-code/guidelines-for-setting-up-a-local-workspace) to get started smoothly.

In case you encounter failing tests during development, please check our [developer FAQs](https://devdocs.jabref.org/code-howtos/faq.html)!

issueDTO.title: FLOA Aperture Error while reading from Zemax Files
issueDTO.description:
<!-- Please complete the following checklist before submitting your issue.
This helps us respond more effectively and keeps the issue tracker focused. -->

### Checklist

- [x] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/HarrisonKramer/optiland/issues) and [discussions](https://github.com/HarrisonKramer/optiland/discussions) for a similar question or problem.
- [x] I have read the [documentation](https://optiland.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) and tried to find an answer there.
- [ ] I am using the **latest version** of Optiland (if not, please update and retry).
- [x] I have tried to reproduce or debug the issue myself before opening this.
- [x] I have included **all necessary context**, such as version info, error messages, or minimal reproducible examples.

*Thanks for taking the time to go through this ??? it really helps us help you!*

### Bug Report

**Describe the bug**
Zemax files with FLOA (Float by Stop) not supported, even though it is set in the code. Example zemax file: [Venus Laowa 10-18mm f4.5-5.6 Zoom.zmx](https://github.com/amegahed/OpticsDatabase/blob/main/Optics/Photography/Venus%20Laowa/Venus%20Laowa%2010-18mm%20f4.5-5.6%20Zoom.zmx)

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Download Zemax file: [Venus Laowa 10-18mm f4.5-5.6 Zoom.zmx](https://github.com/amegahed/OpticsDatabase/blob/main/Optics/Photography/Venus%20Laowa/Venus%20Laowa%2010-18mm%20f4.5-5.6%20Zoom.zmx)
2. Python code: `lens = load_zemax_file(ZMX_FILE)`
3. Error: 
```
raise ValueError('Aperture type must be "EPD", "imageFNO", '
                     '"objectNA"')
ValueError: Aperture type must be "EPD", "imageFNO", "objectNA"
```

**Expected behavior**
Load zemax file without errors. The code seems to handle this case in `zemax_handler.py`:
```
def _read_floating_stop(self, data):
        """
        Extracts the floating stop data.

        Args:
            data (list): List of data values extracted from the Zemax file.
        """
        self.data['aperture']['floating_stop'] = True
```
Though there is a limitation in `aperture.py`:
```
def __init__(self, aperture_type, value, object_space_telecentric=False):
        if aperture_type not in ['EPD', 'imageFNO', 'objectNA']:
            raise ValueError('Aperture type must be "EPD", "imageFNO", '
                             '"objectNA"')
```


**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.


**Environment**  
- Optiland Version: `0.3.0`
- Python Version: `3.13.3`
- OS: `[Windows]`
- Additional Info:


**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.
comments:
Hi @s-dakshin,

Thanks for opening this issue and for providing the complete context. You are correct that Optiland now supports the "float by aperture size" aperture type. However, this change has not yet made its way into the Zemax file reader, so it still raises an error when this aperture type is used. I have already begun an update to address this, which I hope to complete within the next week or two. I can tie that PR to this issue when I create it.

Regards,
Kramer
